intro: Hydrocotyle pedicellosa, commonly known as the creeping marsh plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Araliaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, rounded leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in wet, marshy environments and is often found in shallow water or along the edges of ponds. Hydrocotyle pedicellosa is an aquatic or semi-aquatic plant that plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and supporting aquatic ecosystems.
